sanskrit_verse:
अन्नमेषां पराधीनं देयं स्याद्भिन्नभाजने ।
रात्रौ न विचरेयुस्ते ग्रामेषु नगरेषु च ॥ १०.५४॥
transliteration:
annam eṣāṁ parādhīnaṁ deyaṁ syād bhinnabhājane |
rātrau na vicareyuḥ te grāmeṣu nagareṣu ca || 10.54 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Food shall be provided to them under supervision in separate vessels; they must not wander in villages or cities at night.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the protector's capacity to ensure alignment with dharmic order
Causation arises from the necessity of maintaining social integrity and spiritual safety
Capacity-based responsibility assigns roles according to consciousness-readiness and societal function
Restoration logic prioritizes reintegration through structured guidance and containment
Consciousness alignment requires environmental structuring that supports behavioral harmony
executable_legal_axioms: IF a person is identified as requiring supervised sustenance THEN allocate food via designated distribution under oversight
IF nighttime movement occurs within village or city limits THEN initiate completion protocol for boundary realignment
IF individual demonstrates readiness THEN reassess containment status based on consciousness-readiness metrics
IF community integrity risk detected THEN enforce spatial-temporal boundaries until restoration achieved
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes threshold criteria for protective custody and guided rehabilitation. The court must assess whether an individual poses disruption to collective consciousness and implement containment measures accordingly, always prioritizing restoration pathways over punitive isolation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality identifies unregulated mobility and unsupervised resource access as risks to dharma-sustained order. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential correction beginning with containment, followed by supervised engagement. Responsibility aligns with capacity to uphold communal sanctity. Non-punitive reality rule confirms suffering is not administered but replaced by structure conducive to awakening.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate supervised nourishment delivery using distinct serving vessels to maintain energetic separation
Establish curfew observance aligned with natural rhythm and internal discipline cultivation
Assign guardian-role entities to support transition toward self-regulation
Deploy consciousness-monitoring systems to detect readiness indicators for progressive reintegration
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates.
